comment: Couldn't ask for an easier english class. Only 1 major essay with a couple small assignments and we watched a few movies too. Just show up do the major essay and show up to most of the classes and you more than likely will get an A.

This professor is quite interesting. He did not post a syllabus, nor did he answer emails. There are two essays, both very easy. Just show up and participate. Very frustrating at times, but simple. Nice guy. A little flakey.
He is a great guy, super funny! We never stay for the whole class, however the time we are there seems like he is just making up things to do.

He was a sweetheart. You could tell he enjoyed what he was doing and wanted his students to succeed. Lectures could be a bit boring sometimes. As long as you do the reading and pay attention to the feedback he gives on papers, it's a pretty easy pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Genetti was by far one of my favorite English teachers. He exceeds at making the class enjoyable because of his attitude, jokes, and passion for writing and literature. Also, he teaches in depth, provides many examples, and conducts in-class group activities, which is very helpful. Only had 3 papers! Would definitely recommend.

Professor G is really laid back, and he carries this cool encyclopedia case that you should ask him about. He also brings his guitar and plays for class sometimes. Gives breaks during class, but most of the time we don't stay the full 2 hours and 45 minutes. Only wrote 2 papers. TAKE HIM!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is a great instructor who is very easy to understand. He is very humorous during his lectures. He allows us to have breaks during class (I have a 2 hr 45 min class), and sometimes dismisses us early. The assignments are easy in my opinion. His grading is fair. If you come to class, you will do well.

Professor Genetti is one of the best professors i've ever taken in college. Took him for both 1101 and 1102, and his class is such an enjoyable experience. Assignments are pretty easy, the class flies by, and he is a really nice person. He gets your brain thinking in a writing way that lasts beyond his class as well. 259

Mr. Genetti is one of the best teachers I have had this semester. He is really funny and sarcastic and majority of the time we didn't have to stay the whole class period (3 hour class). The whole semester we had to turned little things into D2L but they were easy. For out final grade we had a research paper and that was the only paper we had to do.

Great professor!!! I enjoyed this past semester so much that I am taking him again for 1102. Only had a couple papers that were a few paragraphs long. I really appreciated him sitting down with each of us after he handed back a paper and going over where we could improve. The class I took was 3 hours but we would usually get out after 1 1/2 hours.

Great teacher and is always willing to help you with any problem you have! He's a really nice guy so respect him and say thank you every once in a while cause he does try his best to help you with any sort of problem you have.

Be careful when registering there are two Genetti teachers, they are father and son. Phillip II is the older one who teaches fridays only who i have now. Now sure about the son but the older one does most of the work in class, now every much homework and assigns a few papers.

Prof Genetti is quirky which is sorta funny and always willing to help or explain things if you don't get it! Gives pop quizzes, but as long as you do the readings it's not bad. He isn't that tough a grader and always welcomes discussion. 4 major papers and the final is a paper too. Show up to class, read your book, turn stuff in,  you'll be good
Take him. He is funny and very helpful!!!
